meanings.definition: Fail to reach the required standard in (an examination, test, or course).
meanings.sent1: Tom flunked his math test last week.
meanings.sent2: She always worries about flunking her driving exam.
meanings.sent3: The cat flunked at catching the mouse, but it was still cute.
meanings.sent4: The idea of time travel flunked in the scientist's mind.
meanings.sent5: The student's face fell when he realized he had flunked the quiz.

meanings.definition: Be unsuccessful in (a task or activity).
meanings.sent1: The team flunked their attempt to build a sandcastle.
meanings.sent2: I hope I don't flunk at baking the cake for the party.
meanings.sent3: The robot flunked at dancing, but it was programmed for cleaning anyway.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence flunked when she couldn't solve the puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's joke flunked, leaving the audience silent.
